subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Quarterback Shaun King, a starter at Tampa Bay when Tony Dungy was the coach there, signed a contract yesterday with the Indianapolis Colts. King, who did not play in the N.F.L. last season, joined the Detroit Lions in March and was released on Wednesday. He will try to make the Colts as Peyton Manning's backup. He has passed for 4,566 yards and 27 touchdowns.
